other_tests.findings: Evidence of L5 radiculopathy on the right side.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Persistent active L5 radiculopathy on the right side that had not improved since the previous study.

other_tests.date: 2 months after initial findings from needle electromyography
other_tests.findings: Persistent active L5 radiculopathy on the right side.
FEV1 of 2.51 liters (77% of the predicted value), FVC of 3.03 liters (70% of the predicted value), and the FEV1/FVC ratio of 83%; indicative of a restrictive ventilatory defect.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Improvements after treatment: FEV1 of 3.05 liters (94% of predicted), FVC of 3.55 liters (82% of predicted), and FEV1/FVC ratio of 86%. FENO decreased to 59 ppb.

other_tests.findings: Nucleated-cell count of 1 per cubic millimeter, protein level of 30 mg per deciliter, and no polymorphonuclear cells or organisms in the Gram's stain.
DNMT3A and CUX1 mutations identified; fluorescence in situ hybridization negative for FIP1L1â€“PDGFRA mutation.
Ulnar neuropathy attributed to known carpal tunnel syndrome and abnormalities in bilateral peroneal nerves.
